title: Drawing, Design for Knotted Pile Hanging with Menorah, ca. 1950
title_raw: Design for Knotted Pile Hanging with Menorah
medium: Brush and gouache, blue watercolor, graphite, red crayon on brown textured paper
signed: Signed in pen and black ink, lower left:  Trude Guermonprez/Pond Farm/Guerneville, CAL
inscribed: Inscribed in pen and black ink, in margin beneath lower right corner of image:  MATERIAL:/WOOL + LINEN = SILK/TECHNIQUE:/KNOTTED IN THE FASHION/OF RYA, I.E.:  FLAT LYING/KNOTS. ON A SOFT PLYABLE/GROUND; above upper left corner of image: I [encircled]
provenance: Eric Elsesser, California; 1993: acquired by Museum
creditline: Gift of Mr. Eric and Mrs. Sylvia Elsesser, The Trude Guermonprez Archives
description: In white textured rectangle, a seven-branched, orange menorah with lit candles.  Between branches and lights, the word "Yisrael" in blue Hebrew characters.  On verso, in graphite, a vertical oval with two horizontal crescent shapes and five circles across center.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, Design for Knotted Pile Hanging with Menorah, ca. 1950. Brush and gouache, blue watercolor, graphite, red crayon on brown textured paper. 
Gift of Mr. Eric and Mrs. Sylvia Elsesser, The Trude Guermonprez Archives. 1993-121-49.
